inn1.comm: and he starts the afternoon with a length delivery going across de Kock, which ends up in the hands of the mid-off fielder
content to just stroke this one straight to the mid-off fielder
exercises good judgment outside his off stump as he lets this one go across and through to the keeper. Definitely bent in upon pitching
slightly wider now outside off as this is struck straight to the short cover fielder
drops the length a touch as de Kock is not at all interested in engaging with this
defends this last one on middle and leg to end a good opening over for the Zimbabweans. Should hopefully settle the nerves
fuller length which is pushed through around a fourth stump line as this is fended away to the leg side by Amla
whips this in just outside off, getting good shape away, as Amla defends this to the off side
overpitched outside off and all Amla does is have a mere push to caress this through to deep extra-cover. Raced away across the fast outfield, but was tracked back before the rope by Elton
straddling on middle and leg as Amla defends straight to mid-on
defends from the crease to this length delivery outside his off stump
slips one down the leg side to bring up the first loose delivery so far
content to just defend this on the front foot towards the off side
fuller delivery which is struck straight to the mid-off fielder
pinpoints the gap just in front of point to bring up the first boundary with a square drive. Provides width on a fuller length which is punished as de Kock frees his arms
shortens the length as he goes across the left-hander, with de Kock content to just bunt this away
squares up de Kock with a length delivery on middle as this seems to almost stop on him as he met the ball. Ends up streaking away through the gully region to third man
looks to nurdle this one away to the leg side, but de Kock's call sends Amla back when he notices the close-in fielder swooping in
full and a hint of away swing as this is struck straight back at the bowler, who inadvertently stops it as he rolls over in his follow through. A few chuckles across the oval when he went to ground
gets away with this loose delivery which goes across de Kock, as he decides at the last moment to throw the kitchen sink, before aborting rather halfheartedly in the end
defended off the back foot by de Kock
gets good carry across the left-hander as de Kock withdraws all limbs from the equation
ends up slapping away this back of a length through cover, not quite getting a hold of it as he went through with the shot
content to just parry this short of a length towards the general vicinity of mid-off

great captaincy from Chigumbura as the change in field has prompted a wicket. Moved second slip earlier to a silly mid-off position, with de Kock chipping this length delivery straight to the fielder. Almost seemed to stop on him as he pushed at the ball. Zimbabwe have got one relatively early on, and the Zimbabwe fans under the scoreboard go mad with ecstasy. I suspect Firdose is somewhere in that red jamboree herself
gets swing away outside off as Amla lets it go
turns this short of a length delivery to the leg side to get Faf on strike
slanting down the leg side as this one is clipped away efficiently behind square
short of a length and angling in as this is defended from the confines of the crease
keeps it tight as he continues to persist with this middle and leg-stump line to Amla
gets this very, very wrong as he splays one down the leg side. Almost a reverse-Harmison really
better from Tinasha as he finishes the over with a slightly back of a length ball on middle and off which is defended by the batsman
fuller length delivery outside off which Faf defends on the front foot
another full delivery in the same channel which is eased down to long on
bunts this back of a length outside off towards the off side
shuffles over to the off stump to work this away through midwicket
straddling down leg as Faf fails to flick this behind square off his hips
almost a carbon copy of the previous delivery, with the result pretty much the same as well
hangs on the back foot as this is pushed straight to the silly mid-off fielder
leans over to try and flick this past the man at silly mid-on, who runs a few paces to his right to cut this off on the fly
similar ball which Amla is given a second opportunity to put away, and he is just too class a batsman to miss out, placing this superbly square off the wicket on the leg side for four
fended away on the front foot towards the off side
shuffles over outside off as this one is flicked away to deep backward square
just opens the face to run this length delivery outside off to third man

this could be a big one. Gets struck just above the roll as this one shapes in from outside off. Chatara goes for the appeal, with the umpire giving it out straightaway. Amla, though, is not convinced, as he asks for a review. No issue with the no-ball. Impact is in-line but this was definitely going on to miss the stumps. So a good referral in the end for South Africa. Amla survives.
fullish length outside off which shapes in a touch as Amla brings down the bat
goes down the track before aborting as Chatara gets extremely good carry of the deck, with the ball sailing outside off to the keeper
looks to be working to a plan here as once again Amla shuffles over to try and turn this away to the leg side, but just can't get enough of the bat on it to make a difference
fuller one now slipped in outside off as Amla dead-bats this away
able to nudge away a single behind square to end the over

length delivery outside off which does enough to get an inside-edge off Amla's bat and go on to hit the stumps. Just snuck through the gate really. Tinashe goes down onto the ground after and does his rendition of the Singing Bass fish (Google it folks)
tests him out with a fuller delivery outside off which is defended competently on the front foot
length, angling in from outside off, as this is fended away to the off side
content to just shoulder arms to this length delivery which gets good carry on the way to the keeper
fuller one again which is dealt with ably by AB
once again defended on the front foot to end a wicket-maiden for Tinasha Panyangara. Fell over after completing that last delivery. Someone get him crutches!
full again, and wide outside off, as all Faf can do is work this away towards backward point
sends in a back of a length outside off which is left alone by the batsman
AB looking to nurdle this one past mid-on, with Faf backing up quite a bit, but sends back his old schoolmate before any damage was done
tries to blaze away a drive through the covers, but picks the fielder
first glimpse of AB in his full flow as he shimmies down to lift Chatara high over long off to hit the boundary rope on the full
waits on the back foot to bunt this short of a length on and around off

so close, so close for Zimbabwe as Faf spoons a chance to this one which stops on him from a length, as he held back just enough for this one to fall a few feet in front of the long off fielder, who had to come in from his deepish position
this time tries to bunt away through the leg side with a rash pull shot
glides Tinashe through third man by opening the face
good carry off the pitch as this one screams in outside off to the keeper
looks to force away a drive on the up through cover, but is stopped dead in his tracks by silly mid-off
just dead-bats this one away to the leg side to bring the over to a close
dabs this length delivery outside off down to third man
straightens the line as this one is whipped away off the pads behind square
plays this one close to the body and behind through gully to run a quick single
fuller one on the pads which is worked away to the leg side
drives this fullish length on the up as this went in the air temporarily before dying on the way to the cover fielder
slow yorker on middle and off which is eased to the man at long on
length delivery which nibbles in a touch as this is defended from the crease
slips one well down the leg side, with the keeper just about able to get his clutches on it
tries to guide this one on the back foot past gully, but to no avail
this time is able to get it away with a slap off the back foot through cover as the batsmen exchange ends
keeps it nice and tight outside off as this is defended on the front foot
not a classic shot from AB, but does the job as he advances down to this shorter length before pulling into the ground through midwicket to find the boundary
eased down to long on for a single to retain the strike
fuller one outside off which is run down to third man as he reaches low to get at the ball
simple dab-and-run outside his off stump to get AB on strike
looks to force one away off the back foot through cover, but doesn't succeed in finding the gap
brings it up outside off as this one is carved away to the mid-off fielder
shuffles to his off stump to turn this straight delivery into one he could get away leg-side, which he does with aplomb
fires one down the leg side as the umpire signals to the scorer
full and in the slot but ends up just clipping this down to long on to end the over
runs this one outside off to third man as they cross for the single
slips one down leg as AB tried in vain to deposit this over Seddon Park behind square on the leg side with a wristy flick
pinpoints the fielder at cover with a laser of a drive
hangs on the back foot before dabbing this away to third man
shimmies down a touch before pulling this powerfully to deep midwicket
short of a length and just worked away off the top of the bounce through the backward point region
flicked away off the pads expertly as the pair put in the hard yards to beat the flat throw from the deep at backward square
carves this one pushed through on middle and off straight to the cover fielder
rocks back before cutting away fiercely through deep extra-cover
lunges forward to meet the ball of this one pitched outside off
played away off the back foot through cover to find the man in the deep
tapped away through the leg side now as they look to rotate strike
uses his crease well to guide this one past the bowler to long on
dabs this one outside off to third man to get play underway after the break
driven firmly on the up to deep extra-cover
punched away off the back foot, but straight to the cover fielder

just stand and deliver from Faf. Tonks a bit hit over long off after dancing down the track before hitting cleanly through the line to send this one into orbit, before descending back from the heavens to land in the deep stands
fuller one which is eased on the front foot to mid-on

and the Zimbabwe captain has the last laugh as he removes Faf with a leg-side delivery which the batsman feathers an edge to as he attempts in vain to glance the ball. The keeper is alert to the chance and runs full tilt to snap this one up. The Zimbabwean fans in the stands are going berserk, and South Africa are now three down within the first 20
picks the gap at cover to run a single
Miller survives his first ball to ease this one darted in on and around off to long on
driven firmly on the front foot towards the cover fielders
goes round the wicket to Miller as he nurdles the bowler through midwicket
defended safely on the back foot
turned away off the back foot behind square, but can't find any vacant space
reaches out to this back of a length delivery outside off, working it to third man, as Elton is guilty of overstepping
gets the yorker wrong, much to his detriment, as Miller sees this one early to get under it and heave it high over cow corner, with this having enough on it to just get over the rope
inside-edges this length delivery onto the pad as he looked to get it away on the leg side
fended away off the back foot, and with delicate hands
tucked away off the back foot this time, but kept it close to the body as he was mindful of the close-in fielder nearby
short and on leg as Miller ends up pulling this one straight to silly mid-on
full delivery on and about off which is struck back to the bowler
gets deep in the crease before working this away down to long on
darts one in on the pads as this is brushed away to deep square-leg
just eased away on the front foot to the leg side
punched off the back foot towards deep extra-cover
reaches out to defend this one from the confines of his crease
tries to force this one away past the bowler on the back foot, but Williams is equal to the task
begins with one which drifts in on middle and leg as this is defended to the leg side

gives this plenty of air as AB doesn't hesitate to go after him, because, after all, he is AB. Lifts this one high over long off, but doesn't have all of it as Ervine, skirting the boundary rope, is able to take the catch with his left hand, then, realising he was going over, leaps in the air while throwing the ball back over to the field of play, and then stepping back once he has gathered himself to complete the take as it came down. Wonderful presence of mind and fielding effort on the boundary as the old adage is proven once more: Catches win matches. The quintessential hokey pokey
lunges forward to defend this on the front foot
Kamun is lit up here as he fields this return which is hit to the left of him
shuffles onto the back foot before whisking this away through square-leg
Duminy right behind the line as Kamungozi ends a wonderful opening over. Debut World Cup? Pshhh.
pushes one through from round the wicket as this is short-arm pulled through midwicket by Miller
hangs on the back foot before stroking this back to Raza
gets nice and low as he nurdles this one towards the short cover fielders on the off side. Able to complete a tight single as well
rocks onto the back foot before scything this away to deep cover
content to just defend this to the off side
slaps this away off the back foot to sweeper cover to end Raza's first over
just eased away to the man at mid-off
given no room to work it away as this is driven back to the same fielder
another one which seems to stop on the batsman as this one pops up temporarily in the space between bowler and mid-on, with the ball landing safely in the end
whipped away off the pads, but straight to square-leg
tries to guide this one past mid-on, but no dice
concentrating on a leg-stump line as this is whisked away to deep square-leg
Raza continues from round the wicket as Miller employs the sweep to good effect
JP plays at this one tentatively before poking away to the leg side for one
slides one down the leg side as the keeper removes the bails after JP overbalanced a touch. Called wide
punched off the back foot as this is worked down to long on
punched away off the back foot to the left of the bowler
cut away square off the wicket for a single
slides one in on middle and leg as this is nudged down to deep midwicket
floats one in on middle and leg which is driven down to deep midwicket for a brace. Brings up the South Africa 100 as well. Not been quite up to their standards today
forced away through long off to find said fielder
pushed through as this one is fended away off the back foot, with Kamun putting in a dive
drops it a short as this one is whipped off the pads
driven straight to mid-off
opens the face to this one sliding past off to get a single through third man
make that 42 as JP eases away a single through long on
driven straight to long off now as JP gets back the strike
drags this one outside off as JP fails to punish him for it, heaving this away over midwicket without any sort of timing
loops in a flighted delivery which is struck away to long on
content to steer Raza through long off
hangs on the back foot before guiding this through to long on to end the over
tries to force away through midwicket, with this one going in the air before dying
tucked away through the leg side now for one
driven straight to the mid-on fielder as he struggles to find the gap
sticking on a leg-stump line as JP nurdles this down to long on
flighted in on middle and leg as this is eased towards cow corner
slows up on the batsman as he tried to tickle this down leg
shortish length, going across the batsman, as this is run down to the slip fielder
tries to strangle him down the leg side, but strays the line as the umpire swivels to signal the scorer
length slanting across which is cut away through backward point
struck firmly to the man at silly mid-off, who despite pulling off the stop, is unable to control the resulting ricochet away from him
shortish length which rises up on Miller as he glances this away to the leg side
short again and this time pulled through midwicket by the left-hander
slapped away off the back foot, but straight to the short mid-off fielder
nudged away on the front foot through the leg side as he reached out to meet the pitch of the ball
JP showing his experience as he rotates strike with a firm drive to long off
waits on the back foot before whisking this away to the backward square fielder
loops one in on middle and leg which is eased to the man at mid-on
rocks back to try and cut this past the cover fielder, but can't achieve the result
tickled away through square-leg to end the over
tries to carve away a shot through mid-off, but no can do
gets a bottom-edge to this short of a length he was trying to carve away through backward point, with the keeper catching the rebound on the bounce
fullish length now which is clipped to the mid-on fielder
slow bouncer which JP sees early as he is able to get enough bat on this swivel-pull which is worked away fine through fine leg for four
searches for the blockhole as he delivers a full delivery wide of off. This one is forced away through the covers
slapped away through point to pickup a single
content to tuck this fuller one away to long on
struck back at the bowler in his follow-through as he looked to force one straight down the ground
continues to keep a tight line as JP is having difficultly working him away through the leg side
elects to go on the back foot as this finds the midwicket fielder
turned away to the leg side within the parameters of his crease
struck away through the long off region to end the 31st over
turns this one into the left-hander, as this is defended from the crease
looking to run this one through the slip region with the angle, but can't find the space with the close-in fielder
this time picks up the single with a clip towards midwicket
flighted on middle and off as this is tapped down to long on
darted in a touch quicker on the same line as the ball ends up in the region once more
ends a quiet over with a bunt to the leg side off the back foot
turned away to the leg side behind square as the pair scamper a single
bissects the gap between cover and extra-cover to bring up a useful boundary for South Africa.
this time tips the ball to the leg side for a well-ran single
hangs on the back foot in an attempt to work this past the square-leg fielder, which doesn't quite come off
pushes through a quicker one on middle and off which is directed away to the leg side by the batsman
hesitant calling denies this potential single down the leg side
able to maneuver this one through square-leg off the back foot to get off strike
goes for the sweep as he gets a top-edge which Taylor looks like he may just reach, but ends up missing. Turns out to have come from the arm of the batsman, so there never was anything in it really
defended by the batsman
defended back to the bowler
leans over before poking this through to deep midwicket
slants away with the angle outside of off as this is cut straight to point
guided away off the back foot to the left of the bowler
width and short from Hamilton as JP picks up the boundary by opening the face to nurdle this past backward point and slip
tries to go for the almighty swat through midwicket, but ends up inside-edging onto himself
lunges forward to defend this one length delivery which has the pace taken off
keeping it tight as JP is given no room to free his arms
pushes this one straight to mid-off to take strike for the Batting Powerplay. That will also be drinks
works away a single to the leg side
looks to give Williams the charge before readjusting his shot to get it away to midwicket
looking to strangle him on middle and leg as this is eased away to midwicket
pulled quite authoritatively through square-leg, but straight to the fielder in the deep
darts one in on the same channel which is bunted away
struck straight back to the bowler to end this first over after drinks
punched away off the back foot to the man at long off
fullish length which is streaked away through third man
fended away off the back foot with delicate hands
chips this fuller one uppishly to the right of the bowler, but no harm done as this lands up at long off
chops this fuller one back towards the bowler in his follow through

easy as you like. If it is in the V, it goes to the trees, in this case, Seddon Park's stands, as he picks this short of a length and deposits it high over backward square leg with a whip of the blade. Just sailed over to the crowd. Plenty of chances for a catch, but this was struck hard
gets turn away to the leg side as the umpire doesn't hesitate to call a wide. They end up running the byes because the keeper failed to collect the take
clipped away on the front foot square off the wicket on the leg side
looking to smash Williams over cow corner before dragging the stroke to get it past square-leg. Raza does well at the boundary to cut it off with a dive
floated in just outside off as this is eased down to long off to bring up David Miller's maiden World Cup fifty. Wonderful knock under pressure from the left-hander
JP keen on rotating strike as he nurdles one away to the leg side
looks like he might be shifting the gears now as he clips one to midwicket
directs this one on leg to the same fielder to keep the strike
and he is greeted to the crease with a swivel-pull through backward square which finds the boundary. Miller the Killer
short on a leg-stump line which is clubbed away by Miller to midwicket
tries to carve away this length delivery going across him, but doesn't make the connection he sought
this time slapped away through backward point as this is stopped before the boundary
plays this back of a length with an angled bat before setting off for the tight single with the ball rolling through long off, which they make
pulls this shorter one authoritatively square off the wicket to retain the strike
defended away to the leg side by the batsman
shuffles over to get behind the turn of this one drifted to the off stump
needled past the bowler to pickup a single through long off

half-trekker which is given the treatment as Miller is just too dangerous in that Suresh Raina zone, which is basically anywhere between midwicket to cow corner. Slams this one off the back foot to find the boundary with ease
sensibly guides this next one past the bowler to long on
tucked away off the pads now as JP scurries to the other end. Brings up his fifty as well as he has played the ideal foil in this innings
punched away from the confines of his crease through cover

Miller is looking very ominious here. Dances down the track before carting the bowler with the cleanest of strikes over cow corner for yet another six. Looks like they made need to get a new ball too as this was sent many a mile back
shows his maturity by glancing away this leg-side delivery for a single
defended back to the bowler off the back foot
JP hesitates as he looks for the vacant space on the leg side, which he fails to achieve
JP decides whatever you can do, I can do better, and since I am batting I am going to belt this one too. Just slams this one high over cow corner after getting down the track. 80m hit from JP.
he is in some mood. Picks the gap at cow corner with a cross-batted swat to this length delivery going across him, powering this through to find the rope before long on had a chance
now picks his spot at cover to find a single
tries to run this short of a length slanting across through backward point, with the fielder putting in an admirable dive to cut it off
ends up bottom-edging this attempted pull into the ground, with the ball momentarily disappearing before resurfacing somewhere near JP's pads
haring on that leg stump as this is eased away to the midwicket fielder
full and on the pads as this is clipped away to the leg side
short bouncer on leg which is hooked away to deep fine leg
attempted yorker which turns into a low full toss, but he can't do any better than locate the man at mid-on
slow bouncer on middle and leg which is called one for the over by the umpire
steers this length delivery going across past the keeper to short third man
careens this full toss away square off the wicket, but straight to the point fielder
searching for the blockhole as this is dug out towards the direction of long on, who fumbles the initial take to allow the batsmen to return for a second
deft from JP as he runs this short of a length away through third man
dabs away this delivery on the same channel, in the process achieving the same result
looking for the wide yorker which doesn't quite come out as he would have liked
again looking for the wide, yorker but this time offers up a low full toss which he is lucky to get away with as this is placed down towards the long off fielder
short ball which is clubbed away through midwicket for one
full again from Tinashe as this one is drilled to the long off fielder
fuller one just outside off which JP is able to dig out and carve away through third man
slow bouncer which JP looked to slam out of Seddon Park, before adjusting for the pace to get this away square off the wicket on the leg side
fires in a yorker which Miller is able to dig out and guide towards long off
doesn't get a hold of this one properly as he drags this hook shot to find the boundary at deep fine leg
offers up a low full toss in his attempt to get it in the block hole, with this one slogged away to the leg side
a gift of a delivery from Chatara as he sends this full toss well wide outside off, but Miller was unable to get any bat on it. Called no-ball by the umpire
once again looking for the base of the stumps as this is struck away towards the vicinity of long off
in the slot for JP and he delivers, bludgeoning this low full toss through the line to find the stands at cow corner
you just can't bowl these kind of deliveries to Miller, especially when he has 80-odd to his name, well, make that 90-odd as he slams Tinashe over long on with a big hit
too full and wide enough for Miller to get under as he moves to 98 with a lofted stroke through extra-cover which screams over the boundary rope into the advertising placards. Two away now
moves to 99 as he drills this fuller one going across straight to long off
gets away with this as he top-edges a hook which he was never in any control of, getting this over the keeper to continue on to the boundary. Partnership moves to 177 now. Fantastic turnaround!
low full toss which should have been deposited in some region of Seddon Park, but ends up landing on the bounce to long on

and he becomes the second 2015 World Cup centurion to join Aaron Finch as Seddon Park stands to applaud a wonderful, counter-attacking effort. Picks up the special milestone, which is also his WC debut hundred, with a clip through midwicket. Outstanding batting from Miller. Play on Killa'
Miller clubs away yet another low full toss through cow corner, with this beating the converging fielders from long on and deep midwicket
changes it up with a bouncer which Miller slaps away towards long off
find the gap through point with a wristy square drive as JP seems to have hit his stride as well now
definitely spotted this slow bouncer going across him early, but just couldn't get it away despite checking his shot
searching for the blockhole but drags this one wide enough of Ervine at long on to find the boundary rope as he just gets under the delivery
finds the base of the stumps this time as all the left-hander can do is drill this straight down to long on
stand and deliver from Killer Miller. Another hit-me ball which is sent to the high heavens as he produces a mighty 86m six over long on
when it is your day, it is your day. Carves away this length delivery going across him through backward point, hitting it at a rate of knots to beat the fielder to the boundary
he is in a murderous mood. Four more for Miller as he pulls this short of a length powerfully through cow corner
Zimbabwe, what are you doing? full and on the pads and all Miller has to do is flick this with his supple wrists to find the deep backward square stand. Just powerful hitting from the SA  finisher
bang, bang, bang. Miller is just on another level now. Short of a length and sliced through third man, and with no one on the boundary, it is safe as a house

unbelievable ball-striking. Hitting at its finest. Picks his spot at long off before lifting this fuller one straight over the bowler before dropping his hands to admire the flight. Zimbabwe losing the plot here at the fag end of the innings
fires it full and well wide of off, Duminy lets it pass, thankfully Taylor dives and gets a hand on it to save a couple of runs
trying to get in the wide yorker but ends up throwing up a low full toss which JP gets enough bat on to chip over mid-off to find the rope
looking to get on top of the bounce of this shorter one on middle and off as he pulls through midwicket, doing well enough to return back for a second
tries to scythe one away through point, but no dice

finally gets it on yorker length, but the batsman is able to dig it out as this streaks away through backward square, with the fielder putting in the dive before rolling on his back, losing the ball again, before flipping over to find it, which gives JP the run he wanted
nurdle aways a single through midwicket to get JP back on strike, who is currently on 97
slower bouncer which JP is early on as he pulls uppishly over square-leg, but this one lands before it could reach the fielder in the deep. Would have been a horrid way to go

talk about one of the more ballsy ways to get to your hundred as he elects to go with the paddle flick over his head and down fine leg to pick up a boundary through the region. JP exhales in celebration as he lifts both arms in the air and looks to the heavens. Has been a wonderful knock to support the Miller special
length ball around off, Duminy hoicks it away between deep midwicket and long on, the duo run two before the ball is hunted down
this time carts the bowler through midwicket for a brace
backs away a smidgen before dragging this fuller one down to long on
slips in a wide which is penalised by the umpire

JP is not done quite yet as he hammers one over long on, and there is a catch in the crowd with the man in orange going absolutely berserk after plucking this one from the air, although he did spill his beer in the process
finishes off the innings with some style now as he carves this fuller, wide delivery through point to get four more

inn2.comm: begins with a loosener down the leg side which the batsman fails to get away as this brushes the pad before continuing behind square
needs to get his radar set as he slips one more down leg
content to shoulder arms to this one bowled on a good length outside off
shortish length which climbs appreciably upon hitting the deck. Left alone by the batsman
better line and length there as he continues to plug away in that corridor of uncertainty, with Raza having a go halfheartedly at it
pitches this up a bit on the same channel as he may have just found the ideal length for this wicket. Raza looked to get forward before withdrawing the blade a touch
too short from Vernon and given the treatment as this is pulled away fiercely through cow corner to bring up the first boundary for Zimbabwe
starts with a fuller length delivery just outside off which is met with the full face as this is driven past the bowler to the straight boundary for four
short of a length and punched away, but straight to the fielder at point
ramps the quickie through third man to beat said fielder with a one-bounce four. All valuable runs here for Zimbabwe

overpitched and on the pads as this is clipped away competently through backward square leg. Vernon, on the boundary edge, puts in the dive, but can't stop it from hitting the rope despite getting a hand on it
on the money from Morkel as Chamu is late on this full delivery outside of off, with the keeper collecting the take behind
happy to withdraw all limbs as this screams by outside off
back of a length and bunted away towards the cover fielder as they steal a single
fuller one which shapes away as Chamu shoulders arms
tries to force one through the covers but ends up mishitting towards the direction of the bowler in his follow through

tries to drill one past the bowler, but Vernon is equal to it as he picks up the return before firing in a reflex throw at the stumps, which he misses, but intimidates the batsman to get back into his crease
another one slanting down the leg side as the umpire stretches his arms
met with a slightly angled face as this is softly fended to the off side
on the pads now as Vernon goes for a shout after this struck the leg pad, but this looked like it was too high and going down leg anyways to cause any incident
covers the line of this length delivery on and around off

blasted away through the covers on the up as they pick up the four runs they so badly need to keep abreast of this required rate. No hesitation to keep this down as he threw everything at this to find the extra-cover rope
slants one in on a middle to leg line which is penalised by the umpire
manages to induce a thick outside edge which flies wide to the fielder at third man
slipping down leg as Raza, looking to hit it more towards midwicket, ends up mishitting towards mid-on
nicely behind the line of this one angling in on the pads
play-and-miss outside his off stump to this shortish length which gets good carry off the deck as it passed through to de Kock
just short of a good length and outside off, Chibhabha gets behind the line and defends with a straight bat
punched past the bowler, but only to find mid-off soon after

sends one smacking into the helmet of Chamu as this one pings him straight on as he looked to duck away from the steepler, with this one going off the helmet and behind to the fine leg boundary. Looked very indecisive
flicked away now behind square to get Raza on strike
Raza ready to throw caution to the wind as he advances down the track in a hope to slice over the covers, but makes sweet connection with thin air
slow bouncer which Raza sees early before deciding to weave out of its path as it carried through to the keeper
strides forward before defending this length delivery to the off side
keeps the gap between bat and pad closed as this one angles in on middle and off
squares him up with a short of a length which bounces higher than he expected as this hits the splice to bobble over to the off side, but thankfully safe from any danger
clipped away now towards midwicket, but can't find the vacant area
delivers a yorker on a middle to leg line which has Chamu getting under it this time
content to get under another one which bounces overhead as the over comes to a close
withdraws his blade to this fuller one steaming past off stump

and Philander gets things going for South Africa with a length delivery on a tighter line closer to off stump as Raza ends up chopping this one onto the stumps, with his feet rooted in place. Raza's brief stint comes to a close
short ball outside off which is wisely left alone by Hamilton
oh dear, oh dear where is the discipline? slips one down leg as the umpire signals to the scorer
better now as he shifts the line of attack outside off, with Hamilton edging this away through third man
has a flash at this just back of a length outside his off stump, with some shape away from the batsman
fuller now in the same channel as this is drilled straight to mid-off, with the pair scampering through for the single
not quite got a lock on proceedings as he strays down leg, with this brushing the thigh guard before continuing through to the fine leg boundary
better now as he delivers a short of a length ball outside off which is punched away towards the covers
gets good shape away as this one is delivered in the same channel on a slightly fuller length, with Chamu steering this past point to find the boundary. Rare blunder in the field from SA
nibbles one away on a length just outside off as Chamu plays devilishly close to the line
nicely behind the line of this one swinging away as this one is punched straight to silly mid-off
length ball angling down the pads as all Chamu has to do is get a tickle on it as this flies wide of short backward square to find the rope
solid defensive shot on the front foot as this one is sent to the cover fielder
able to glide away this length delivery outside off to third man
short from the bowler, and outside off, as the third umpire signals one for the over
tucked away off the back foot towards mid-on as they scurry for the tight single
slanting down the pads as this is tapped away on the leg side by the batsman. Brings up the fifty as well for Zimbabwe
tries to guide one past the point fielder, but this time the fielder is equal to the task after putting in a dive
length wide of off which shapes away on the way to the keeper
tries to dab this one past Faf at point, but no dice
short and Hamilton opts for the pull through long on, but is cut off by a wonderful dive at mid-on
this time Chamu gets the length for the pull as he strokes this comfortably away over cow corner
clipped away off the pads now to get to the other end
gets behind the line of this length delivery as the over comes to a close
starts with a fuller length ball which is steered to the leg side by the batsman
Hamilton plants the food to try and drill this through cover, but is stopped by the short cover fielder
this time forces it away off the back foot to get the single
full and straying on the pads as this is clipped away behind square
hits this one uppishly back in the direction of the bowler, but powered it enough so that Farhaan couldn't even get a mitt on it
gets the line wrong as he drifts down leg
short outside off and scythed away through the covers
slices away Steyn through third man as the fielder is brought into play
shorter one which Hamilton goes after, pulling this uppishly over midwicket before landing safe in the end
another one which is sliced away outside off as third man fields the ball before the boundary
defended away from the confines of his crease
hangs on the back foot before bunting this away towards the off side
straddles down middle and leg as Hamilton fails to get this away through the leg side
is late on this one angling in on middle and leg as it strikes him on the thigh pad
fuller one which is struck towards the mid-on fielder
floats one in outside off which is drilled straight to mid-off
looking to up the ante as he lifts Farhaan over the covers, but doesn't get enough on it to reach the boundary rope
fullish length which is nurdled towards mid-on, who has a shy at the non-striker's stumps
short, half-trekker which Farhaan drags as this is pulled efficiently through midwicket for four
floated up on middle stump line, Masakadza bunts it back to the bowler
continues round the wicket as Hamilton looks to be adventurous as he attempts a reverse sweep
this time clipped away to the leg side
gets this one to spin in after pitching outside leg
punches this off the back foot, but straight to the cover fielder
leans forward before turning this to the leg side with deft hands
play-and-miss outside off to this short of a length which carries nicely off the deck
Mt Masakadza pulls this shortish length powerfully through midwicket to bring up a boundary
now picks the gap at point to smash away this fullish length outside of off. This one just streaked away off the surface
gets the bat down to this fuller length on the same channel
runs this one outside off down to third man for one
fuller now and nibbling in a touch as this is defended on the front foot
continues round the wicket as Hamilton picks his spot at long off before clubbing JP over the region to bring up four runs
shows his more innovative side with a deft reverse sweep pulled off to perfection as the ball gets past the close-in fielder on the ring
darts one in across the big right-hander as he picks up a single with a push to long off
backs away to create room before striking this one back to JP
this time glances away to the leg side, but can't pinch the single
fuller now as he needles a run through midwicket
opens the face to glide this down to third man
goes for the good ole tap-and-run outside off as Chamu makes it to the danger end with an ungainly dive
length on and around off which is tucked away to the leg side
tries again for the tap-and-run, but hits it a bit too straight to the fielder at point
searching for the yorker as he sees Hamilton back away, so he follows him with this inswinging delivery. Good cricket all around as Hamilton digs this one out
slower one outside off which Hamilton almost drags on, but is lucky as the ball continues through towards backward square
begins with a low full toss down the leg side which is clipped away
eased away on the front foot to long on
drilled firmly to the man at mid-off, who gets safely behind the ball
struck away past a sprawling mid-off as they cross for the single
shows his variation with a quicker one which the batsman is late on as he is struck on the pads, but this looked like it was slipping down leg
bowls a wrong'un this time which the batsman has no idea off
tries to get this one past the close-in field on the leg side, but this is South Africa, so just no

hangs on the back foot before tucking this one away with deft hands to bring up a 10th ODI fifty. Has been a wonderful effort from the right-hander, but his team will need him to press on to bigger and better things
employs the sweep to good effect as the ball is fielded just before the backward square boundary
punched away off the back foot towards the leg side
this time content to drive down to long off to bring up the Zimbabwe 100
slapped away outside off to sweeper cover
defended away to the leg side
driven down towards the bowler now, who puts in a dive
Hamilton finds the single as he pierces the vacant space at long off

Tahir thinks he may have got his man as he utters a loud appeal, with AB and him deciding whether to pursue the review, before the former decided against it. This one struck after turning on the thigh guard, but it may have just been going down leg
struggling to pick Tahir at the moment as this one spins away now
gets this to turn in after drifting on off, with the ball clipped away to the leg side
Hamilton sends Farhaan out of the oval with a huge bludgeon over cow corner, with this one going high up in the air before carrying enough to get over the boundary
this time gives himself room to cut away fiercely through point

smart batting from Hamilton as he notices fine leg is inside the circle. Ends up paddling this one heading down the leg side over his shoulder to find yet another boundary. Has constructed his innings beautifully thus far
content to just steer this fuller one down to long on
struck away to the off side, but can't pierce the gap
finishes it off with a fuller delivery which is helped down to long on by the batsman
shimmies down a touch before easing this away through to deep midwicket
floats one outside off which spins away sharply as Hamilton works with it to cut it away
defended on the front foot from the relative safely of his crease
steers Tahir through long on to get to the other end
turned away now to the leg side as they cross over
did this carry? Chamu pushes at this one uppishly in the direction of Tahir, but this may have died on the way to the spinner as he dove forward to try and snaffle the chance
begins with a fullish delivery outside off which is driven back to him at a rate of knots
how audacious was this? Hamilton steps down and then proceeds to thwack Steyn over the covers as though he was some mere club bowler. Fantastic shot to bring up his fifty
sensibly gets away a single on the leg side to this length delivery on the hips
content to let this one fly through to de Kock
delivers a length delivery wide of off which is struck powerfully on the up through the covers, with short cover putting in a dive to his right in vain
short and pounced upon by Chamu, but is unlucky to locate the deep midwicket fielder on the bounce
tries to pull this one slipping down leg, but is late on the ball. Doesn't matter as a wide is called anyways
gets down the track as he picks his spot at cow corner, and finds it with aplomb with a delightful chip in the region
eased away off the toes towards the leg side
almost succeeds in chopping one onto the stumps as this streaks away through backward square. Partnership over a 100 by the way
tries to send this one careening through the covers, but ends up dragging the stroke towards the bowler
dances down before adjusting to try and place this past square-leg, but to no avail as the fielder picks up the ball to fire in a throw at the keeper's end

and Tahir makes the crucial breakthrough for South Africa as Chamu departs the oval after mishitting a slice over extra-cover, with this one dying just before the rope where the fielder was staioned. JP is able to keep himself within the playing field and take this. Ends a spirited knock from the Zimbabwean opener
short outside off which is allowed to go through to the keeper
defended away towards the off side
short and given the treatment as Hamilton pulls this authoritatively through cow corner
short again and slanting down leg as Hamilton, who is not quite in control, hooks this away to backward square, with the fielder at deep fine leg unable to get around to it
simply opens the face to run this one down to third man
shoulders arms to this length delivery which climbs as it reaches the keeper
eased away to the leg side by the batsman
plays just outside the line of this as the ball grabs the inside-edge to go behind square
punched away now off the back foot to long on
elegant from Taylor as he lifts Tahir over the covers, and with no one in the deep on the off side, ends up being a viable option
squares him up a touch as this one turns in after pitching on and around leg on a fuller length
defended away to the leg side by the batsman
expertly ramps the fast bowler over third man, but can't get it away to the boundary as Steyn shows wonderful commitment in the position to dive and cut this off before the rope
fended away on the front foot as they scamper for the quick single
fullish length which is edged away towards backward point
gets nicely behind the line to cover for any deviation
overpitched and dispatched down the ground by Taylor for a one-bounce four
steered away now on the front foot to third man
turned away to the leg side for one
delivers this one well down the leg side
brushed away off the pads towards the general vicinity of midwicket
able to clip this away off the hips as they continue to rotate strike
drives the spinner down to long on for a sedate run
content to just defend this to the leg side
goes for the sweep as he picks out Morkel at short backward square
looks to ramp this slow bouncer, but is late on the ball
this time pitches it up, with this one called one for the over after Hamilton failed to paddle this over fine leg despite going down on one knee
driven straight to the bowler in his follow through
looks for the dab down to third man
ramps this shorter one from Philander over to the fielder at third man
pulls this short ball away to deep midwicket to bring the over to a end
crashed away off the back foot to the man at long on
flicked away now behind square as they cross ends
called a wide as he fails to paddle-sweep this past the keeper and down fine leg
nurdled away off the back foot as they complete a straightforward single
reaches out to meet this one before the ball spun away to brush the thigh guard
executed the paddle sweep round the corner with ease as the quicker, flatter trajectory helped Taylor get this away in the gap
helps himself to single down to deep midwicket
just can't get this one drifting in on middle and off away
offers up a low full toss which is clubbed away to deep midwicket
this time goes for the paddle sweep which has de Kock racing after it, but this one lands safely at backward square
this time guided away to the cover fielder
punched off the back foot towards the mid-off fielder, who picks up and fires in a throw on the fly at the non-strikers, which challenges the batsman to make his ground. You don't mess with AB

de Kock able to whip off the bails to this one which spins away from Hamiton as he looked to slam this out of the ground. The umpire is unsure if Hamilton got his foot back over the line when the bails were disturbed, but the third umpire confirms the decision soon after
driven off the back foot down to long on
this time whipped away off the pads for one
meets this one with a full face as the ball falls away to the leg side
this time threads the gap at long on to get to the other end

drags this one a bit but this has to be Hamilton's day, and why not since the city is named the same. Able to slug away the spinner over midwicket, with the fielder near the boundary unable to catch this one before the rope
and another one goes to ground as JP is left scratching his head. This time Hamiton looks to slice over cover, getting this high over backward point, but landing safe in the end
darts in a quicker one which is helped down to long on
waits on the front foot before covering for the turn
this time squares him up with the wrong'un as the ball is hit towards the off side

dropped another one hit towards the bowler today, except this time it carried, as Tahir, more for self-preservation then anything else, is unable to get any fingers on it as it is struck straight back at him at stomach-height
bunts this one down to mid-on and gets to the other end

Tahir has landed the big one as he removes Hamilton with one which turns away as the batsman looked to get it away through midwicket before offering a leading edge which spoons harmlessly to Amla at cover, who takes it with glee. Leaves the oval with 80 to his name, and it really has been an inspired knock under pressure
eases away Duminy through long on for one
driven firmly by Sean towards the covers as he gets off the mark
bunted away to the leg side as he searches for the vacant space
just about fends away this one which spins in from outside off
nurdles a single through the leg side to get Williams on strike
sends this one straight to the mid-off fielder to end the over
goes for the tap-and-run outside off which they execute to perfection
defended by the batsman

looks like he may have been struck in line as he looks to punch this away. There is a momentary delay as Sean is unsure whether he will be given, but Taylor wants the run as he crosses over the other end. SA want to review this though. Looks like it might be a little high, with no contact made with the bat as per Snicko. The decision comes down and they rule the lbw not out, but hold on, now they are checking for the run-out, but he looks like he may have made his ground anyways, so all is well that ends well I suppose
takes this length delivery outside off and deposits it over cow corner with a powerful blow. 200 up for Zimbabwe
backs away to the leg side before going for the percentage strike down long off to pickup a one-bounce four
looks for the gap at fine leg as Taylor ends up paddling this over in that region, but not where he would have liked it
begins with a fullish length outside off which is driven towards cover
gets this to nibble in from a middle and off line as Sean is a touch late on it as the ball gets inside-edged onto his pads
in the slot and Williams shows his class with a lovely drive on the up as this one just raced away across the turf
length delivery on a wider line as Williams looks imploringly to the umpire for any kind of sympathy
short and pulled powerfully to deep midwicket by Williams
able to get away this shorter one on the leg side for a single

and the drinks break claims yet another victim as Taylor has to go now with a halfhearted slog to this slower delivery on middle and leg. Taylor goes for a well-played 40 as this chase threatens to get away from them
tries to steer this one past backward point, but this is South Africa! so yeah, nothing comes out of it
looks for the chip down long on to this slow ball on middle and leg
another slow ball from Morne which does the trick, with this one striking high on the bat to pop up over mid-off, but away from any fielders
gets away a pull through midwicket as they complete a brace
lets go off the handle as he fails to get this pull away through the leg side to this slow bouncer from Morks
continues round the wicket as this is fended to the off side
eases the spinner to mid-on as he gets himself to the other end and out of the hot seat
looks to get down the track before playing this one back at the bowler
top-edge which goes straight up in the air as the keeper calls this one before completing the catch safely. Really didn't go anywhere at all. Looks like the pressure is starting to get to them now
nudges this one away square off the wicket on the leg side
helped down to long on to bring this successful over for SA to a close
manages to pickup a single through gully
short and looking to hook this over backward square, but is late on it
brings the bat down to this short of a length going across him
fullish length on the pads as Ervine fails to clip this away
glanced away now behind square as they cross over for the single
short outside off and just swatted across the line over extra-cover. Unbelievable blow from the Zimbabwe captain, truly against the run of play as he stood and delivered
advances down before working this away just behind square to the close-in fielder
strikes the pad on his front leg as he plays down the wrong line. Duminy likes it as he appeals to the umpire, but not given
tries to force one away on the up through cover, but to no avail
flatter delivery on middle and off which is defended back to the bowler
content to just drive this one back to Duminy
decides he has to go with a wristy flick over midwicket which goes the distance. Easy as you like from Ervine
looking for the yorker as this full delivery is lasered to the cover fielder
strikes him on the toe with this full delivery, but was definitely heading down leg, despite the mild interest from the bowler
just eased away off the back foot through the off side as they scurry a quick single
sees the batsman backing away so he delivers a slightly wide yorker which Elton is unable to get at

searching for the blockhole now as he lets go of a low full toss which is clipped away behind square, with AB pouncing on this at mid-off to fire in a throw at the striker's end, with the batsman short of his ground as he veered away in his attempt to ground the bat. You just can't take on AB's rocket arm
fails to get away this pull as they end up running the leg bye regardless
gets this one to spin away as this is placed on the off side for one
gets this one to drift in and spin sharply on the batsman, who plays all around it
this is the straighter one which is fended away on the front foot
almost gets Mire to chop on as he floats in another wrong'un which the batsman fails to pick as he looks for the short-arm pull
once again drags the stroke as he fails to pick Tahir's variation
this time works with the spin away from him to get deep and punch this straight to mid-off
gets an inside-edge to this slower, length delivery from Steyn, with the ball streaking away behind on the leg side
full and on the money as this is dug out by the batsman
reaches out to this slightly wide delivery outside off, with the result being a drive at the cover fielder
goes for the pull to this shorter one as midwicket comes into play
slow ball going across the batsman as he opts for the offcutter, which the batsman is not even in the same time zone of
short ball which rushes on Ervine as he ends up offering a simple top-edge chance to mid-on, who snaps it up gleefully. Ervine has to go and Zimbabwe in the doldrums now at 240 for 7
able to drive this one to the cover point fielder
covers for the turn as he presents a dead, straight bat to Tahir
slips in his conventional leggie which Tinasha connects with as he goes for the lofted sweep through cow corner, which he gets away in the end despite the man in the deep
bowls a lovely googly which turns sharply into Tinashe's pads

AB pulls off another special catch in the ring as Tahir claims yet another at Seddon Park, getting Tinashe to provide a leading edge to this attempted sweep, with AB running full tilt from backward square to complete the take
spoons a chance uppishly through long on, but with no in the vicinity, turns out to be a safe option
bang on target as Mire somehow manages to dig this yorker on middle out, with the ball continuing on through third man

Mire will probably not forget that one in a while. He only manages to take on one of the best in the world with a lovely flick behind square which sails all the way over the boundary rope. Steyn will be livid
and manages to dig out another yorker haring on off stump. Seems only a matter of time though...
this time opts for the slower bouncer as he sees Mire hanging back in his crease in preparation for the yorker
overpitched outside off as Steyn gets this slightly wrong, with the drive from Mire having enough legs on it to beat the cover and mid-off fielder to the boundary
sensational hitting from Steyn as his horror match continues. Mire just picks his spot before punishing Steyn with a blow through long off
goes up for a loud, raucous appeal as he strikes the pads, but this might have been slipping down leg
goes for the conventional leggie as Tendai fails to glide this one away through third man
looks for the big heave down the ground which goes straight up, but this falls safe as there are no fielders stationed between long off and mid-off
driven back to the bowler as he covers for the spin
clubs yet another one with the spin to deep midwicket, but can't get it either side of him on the boundary rope
gets through the final ball as Tahir wraps up a tidy spell of 3 for 36

that just might be the biggest six of the tournament as Mire showcases his IPL credentials with a huge scythe over cow corner that just flew high over the stand. This may have even departed the oval. Tremendous strike from the Zimbabwean!
goes for another big heave down the ground to this widish, full delivery outside off
ends up going too fast through his stroke to this bouncer on middle and off
yet another play-and-a-miss as the ball is saved from another demoralising strike from Mire's blade
wide of the crease and Morkel won't get away it as the umpire goes through the motions
fullish length outside off which he fails to get any bat on as Morkel has found the right channel to get through these final death overs
overpitched and thundered down the ground by MIre, but is cut off by a dive from the long on fielder

AB pops up again in the deep as Philander has got them just one away now as Mire, looking to smash every remaining delivery out of the park, ends up pulling this towards de Villiers at deep midwicket, who puts in a wonderful forward dive to catch him in the deep. Ends a very entertaining cameo from Mire. Will be great to see more pyrotechnics from him as this tournament wages on
reaches out to this fuller length, almost inside-edging this as it continues on to the keeper
searching for the yorker as he ends up giving up a low full toss which is struck back to him. The batsmen run the single as Philander turns to fire in a throw at the non-striker's, but misses
low full toss which is in the slot as this is blazed away through the covers for a boundary
is well late on this bouncer outside off which Tendai fails to ramp over third man
able to cart away this fuller delivery on and around off to the mid-on fielder
advances down the track before realising this is an attempted wide yorker, so tries to readjust to get at it, but fails to do so
and with a simple return chance to this full delivery on middle, Morkel has snapped up the final scalp to give South Africa a 62-run victory in the end
